goal.tools.mc.property.ltl2aut

Class LTL2AUTProp

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.mc.property.ltl2aut.LTL2AUTProp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Automaton, Property

    public class LTL2AUTProp
extends java.lang.Object
implements Property
    Represents a property automaton, computed by the algorithm of Daniele et al. (1999).
    Author:
    sungshik

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LTL2AUTProp(Formula f)
      Constructs a property automaton for the specified LTL formula.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void generate()
      Generates the entire state space of the automaton.
      LTL2AUTState getInitial()
      Gets the initial state of the automaton.
      Formula getProperty()
      Gets the property under investigation.
      int getSize()
      Gets the number of states for which successors have been defined (this is not necessarily equal to the number of states that have already been identified).
      LTL2AUTState[] getSuccessors(State q_)
      Gets the successors of q.
      void printAutomaton()
      Prints the (partially constructed) automaton that this object represents.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LTL2AUTProp

        public LTL2AUTProp(Formula f)
        Constructs a property automaton for the specified LTL formula. The automaton itself, however, is not yet constructed as this may occur on-the-fly. To create the automaton, call generate().

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public void generate()
        Description copied from interface: Automaton
        Generates the entire state space of the automaton. Although implementations of this interface may decide how the automaton is represented and stored internally, it is assumed that some internal storage facility is present (otherwise, this method would not make much sense).
        Specified by:
        generate in interface Automaton

        public int getSize()
        Description copied from interface: Automaton
